p: Animal model development with wild-type and cDNA clone versions of the VEE IC INH-9813 strain is still in the early stages [ 71]. Aerosol challenge of BALB/c mice with the VEE IC INH-9813 strain (10 mice/group) resulted in lethal disease at low challenge doses, with 100% lethality at 2150 pfu, 80% lethality at 195 pfu, and 20% lethality at 16-pfu challenge doses ( Table 5). Histopathology studies have not yet been performed. Aerosol challenge of cynomolgus macaques (challenge doses ranging from 30 to 5.94 Ã— 10 8 pfu) with VEE IC INH-9813 resulted in nonlethal disease in all 11 NHPs, with a febrile illness observed even at the lowest 30-pfu challenge dose (one NHP only) ( Table 5). Fever, viremia, and lymphopenia were observed as potential markers of infection.
